shortdesc: Materials depicting the impact of the "Spanish Flu" on the University of Idaho Campus
description: The 1918 Flu Pandemic Collection brings together correspondence, reports, news articles, oral histories, and other materials that highlight the local response to the 1918 pandemic.

colltitle: Adult Salmon and Steelhead Migration Studies: 1996-2014
shorttitle: Adult Salmon and Steelhead Migration Studies
shortdesc: Fish migration datasets and an extensive catalog of technical reports and peer-reviewed publications pertaining to the study of migrations, dam passage behaviors, and survival of adult salmon and steelhead in the Columbia River basin since the 1990s.
description: The University of Idaho's Fish Ecology Research Lab in collaboration with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, NOAA-Fisheries, and other research partners has used radiotelemetry to study the migrations, dam passage behaviors, and survival of adult salmon and steelhead in the Columbia River basin since the 1990s, amassing one of the world’s largest fish migration datasets along with an extensive catalog of technical reports and peer-reviewed publications.

shortdesc: University of Idaho agricultural economics research
description: A series of documents focused on agricultural economics produced by University of Idaho researchers.

shortdesc: Primary sources for practical, research-based information on Idaho Agriculture, Forestry, Gardening, and Family and Consumer Sciences
description: A collaboration between the Library and University of Idaho Extension, the University of Idaho Extension and Idaho Agricultural Experiment Station Publications collection features over 2000 publications that serve as the primary source for practical, research-based information on Idaho agriculture, forestry, gardening, and family and consumer sciences.
imagetitle: Seed beds at Boulder Nursery, Mont.

shortdesc: University of Idaho's Newspaper, 1898-2010
description: The Argonaut is the newspaper of the University of Idaho. We hold historical copies from 1898-2010
imagetitle: Post from our Tumblr featuring Argonaut Ad

shortdesc: Over 700 photographs from the University of Idaho newspaper, The Argonaut.
description: Over 700 photographs from the University of Idaho newspaper, The Argonaut.
imagetitle: A student looking through the library card catalog

shortdesc: Awards and photographs from the Al Grey Collection
description: Al Grey was a jazz trombonist and bandleader. Rosalie Soladar was his companion and personal manager. Materials in this collection span most of Grey's career after their partnership. The digital collection includes photographs and images of awards and ephemera

shortdesc: A Newsletter of the (University of Idaho) Arboretum Associates
description: A collection of newsletters pertaining to the University of Idaho's Arboretum and Botanical Garden, including reports, gardening tips, and other information.

shortdesc: Rare Idaho Photographs from Archives around the Country
description: Collected by Dennis Baird over several years and many trips to government archives and described by Idaho native Jordan Wrigley, the Archival Idaho Photograph Collection features some of the earliest extant photographs of Idaho, as well as countless other historical gems related to our fine state.
imagetitle: Playground and wading pool, Idaho Falls

shortdesc: Historical Photographs of Northern Idaho Mines, Towns, and Scenery, 1894-1964
description: The Barnard-Stockbridge Collection exhibits over 1000 photographs, selected from over 200,000 nitrocellulose and glass plate negatives, taken by Nellie Stockbridge and T. N. Barnard during the years 1894-1964. The photos depict various aspects of life in the Wallace/Kellogg mining area.
location: Wallace, ID; Kellogg, ID; Burke, ID; Mullan, ID; Wardner, ID; Cataldo, ID; Silver Valley area in Idaho; Coeur'Alene, ID; Lolo Pass, MT;

shortdesc: An exhibition of materials related to the 'Big Burn' fires of 1910
description: The Big Burn Collection is an online exhibit of materials related to the 'Big Burn' fires of 1910 that devastated much of Northern Idaho and Northwest Montana. The collection includes photographs, documents, first-person accounts, and oral histories pertaining to the fires and the local and national responses to them.
location: Wallace, ID; Lolo Pass, MT; Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness Region
imagetitle: Forest Fire - Wallace Idaho Aug 20, 1910 Men burned in the fire

shortdesc: Photographs from the collection of the Latah County Historical Society
description: Photographs from the collection of the Latah County Historical Society

shortdesc: 463 letters of correspondence between the managers and owners of the Bunker Hill Mine and Sullivan M. & C. Co.
description: The Bunker Hill Labor History Collection is 463 letters of correspondence between the managers and owners of the Bunker Hill Mine & Sullivan M. & C. Co.

colltitle: C. H. Shattuck, Idaho Lantern Slides, 1904-1910
cdmtitle: C. H. Shattuck, Idaho Lantern Slides, 1904-1910
shortdesc: Early twentieth century slides depicting the University of Idaho, as well as the wilderness of Idaho and Idaho residents' attempts at domesticating it
description: Charles Houston Shattuck was a professor in the College of Agriculture (now Natural Resources) who initiated 'Arboretum Hill' (now known as the Charles Houston Shattuck Arboretum). These early twentieth century slides depict the University of Idaho, as well as the wilderness of Idaho and Idaho residents' attempts at domesticating it.
location: Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness Region; Bitterroot Mountain, ID; University of Idaho; Moscow, ID; Packers Meadows, ID; Kaniksu National Forest, MT; Lolo Hot Springs, MT;

cdmtitle: Carleton Watkins Mine Interiors Collection (1890, Butte, MT)
shortdesc: Interior photos of mines in Butte, Montana, 1890, hundreds of feet below ground
description: Among the riches of the historical photograph collections of the University of Idaho Library is an oversize portfolio of eighty original Carleton E. Watkins photographs. Long considered lost, these photographs of the interior of the Anaconda Mines in Butte, Montana, were taken in 1890. They show early hard-rock mining techniques, equipment, and men deep underground.
imagetitle: Anaconda Mines - Mt Con 400 level East sill floor

shortdesc: Handbook prepared regularly by the Western Beef Resource Committee (WBRC)
description: The Cattle Producer's Handbook is prepared by the Western Beef Resource Committee (WBRC), which consists of beef specialists, economists, range scientists, animal nutritionists, county educators, and veterinarians from the Cooperative Extension System and cattle industry.

shortdesc: A collection of packets from the Chatcolab Northwest Leadership Laboratory. Chatcolab offers a unique opportunity to build leadership by engaging in the creative planning and then sharing of a recreational experience.
description: The Chatcolab Northwest Leadership Laboratory has been running each summer since 1949. Chatcolab offers a unique opportunity to build leadership by engaging in the creative planning and then sharing of a recreational experience. This collection of packets was donated by Bob Carver to the University of Idaho Library and digitized by the digital initiatives unit in 2017.

colltitle: Columbia River Basin Project: Dam Construction in the Pacific Northwest
cdmtitle: Columbia River Basin Project: Dam Construction in the Pacific Northwest
shortdesc: Historical photographs of Grand Coulee Dam and Columbia River Basin Project construction, 1933-1965
description: Digitized photographs pertaining to the Columbia Basin Project. Special emphasis is placed on the construction of Grand Coulee Dam, the canal systems of Central Washington, and numerous other dams in the Inland Northwest.
location: Grand Coulee, WA; Canal systems of Central Washington

shortdesc: 11 Contemporary Poets on writing through the advent of the personal computer and into the arrival of the digital age.
description: CTRL+SHIFT is an online collection of audio recordings, transcripts, process visualizations, and data analyses broken out from interviews conducted with 11 prominent contemporary American poets from across the United States. The project examines recent changes in writing practices that occurred due to the advent of the computer and the arrival of the digital age and investigates new modes of working with and publishing data from qualitative interview studies.
location: Los Angeles, CA; Cambridge, MA; Irvine, CA; New York, NY; Moscow, ID; Liberty Lake, WA; Ashland, OR; Long Beach, CA; Cambridge, MA; Bellingham, WA; San Diego, CA;

shortdesc: Website records of past digital scholarship at the University of Idaho
description: Website records of past digital scholarship at the University of Idaho

shortdesc: Images and memorabilia from the Dizzy Gillespie Collection.
description: This collection was assembled by Special Collections and Archives of the University of Idaho Library with materials donated by Mrs. Gillespie. The collection contains fifteen items that belonged to the artist.

colltitle: Donald R. Theophilus Boxing Photograph Collection
cdmtitle: Donald R. Theophilus Boxing Photograph Collection
shortdesc: Photographs of University of Idaho Boxers and Boxing Teams, 1934 - 1953
description: A digital collection comprised of 52 photographs of boxers and boxing teams from the University of Idaho

categories: Dams; Construction; Water; Northwest; Idaho; Maps;
shortdesc: Documenting the Development and Construction of the Doworshak Dam, 1952 - 1975
description: Digitized photographs and documents pertaining to the planning, development and construction of the Dworshak Dam, featuring documents and photographs detailing both the legislative and physical development of the dam.
imagetitle: Aerial view of clearwater river before construction of Dworshak Dam

shortdesc: Slides from longtime College of Agriculture Dean, Edward John Iddings, including university-, agriculture-, and travel-related images
description: Edward John Iddings was the Dean of the College of Agriculture at UI from 1915 to 1946. These slides depict agricultural and university-related scenes from Idaho, as well as images from Iddings' travels.
location: University of Idaho (Admin building); Moscow, ID;

shortdesc: Nature photographs taken by Ernest E. Day
description: Photographs taken by Ernie Day depicting just a few of the many mountains and lakes found in Idaho, particularly those found within the Sawtooth National Recreation Area.

colltitle: Experimental Forest and Savenac Nursery Photo Archive
cdmtitle: Experimental Forests and Savenac Nursery Photo Archive
shortdesc: Historical photographs of Experimental Forests and Savenac Nursery in Northern Idaho and Northwestern Montana, 1910 - 1989
description: The Experimental Forest and Savenac Nursery Photo Archive contains photographs related to or depicting the establishment of two Forest Service Experimental Forests in north Idaho, Priest River and Deception Creek, and the Savenac Nursery in Montana.
location: Priest River, ID; Deception Creek, ID; Savenac Nursery, MT;
imagetitle: Interior view of thinning in 65-year western white pine.

colltitle: Family Tree Collection, a Potlatch Forests, Inc. Newsletter
cdmtitle: Family Tree Collection, a Potlatch Forests, Inc. Newsletter
shortdesc: A Potlatch Forests, Inc. Newsletter Published from 1936-1952
description: The Family Tree was a newsletter published by Potlatch Forests, Inc. for their employees from 1936 - 1952. The newsletter covers local (Potlatch area) and national events, with a special focus on issues pertaining to Potlatch Forests and its loggers and other employees.

shortdesc: University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Guides and Descriptions
description: Finding Aids are guides to the physical collections held by the Library's Special Collections & Archives Department. All material mentioned in these guides can be read or examined by request. See here for more information about accessing these materials.

shortdesc: The official literary journal of the University of Idaho's English Department
description: Fugue is the official literary journal of the University of Idaho's English Department.
location: University of Idaho (English Department); Moscow, ID;

colltitle: Gem of the Mountains Digital Yearbook Collection
cdmtitle: Gem of the Mountains Digital Yearbook Collection
shortdesc: The official yearbook of the University of Idaho from 1903 to 2004
description: The Gem of the Mountains was the official yearbook of the University of Idaho from 1903 to 2004.

shortdesc: A library of guided reading material from the University of Idaho College of Education, curated by Margaret Vaughn
description: The Guided Reading Library is a digital collection of short books created by students in the University of Idaho's College of Education. This library is directed by Margaret Vaughn, in collaboration with the Digital Inititiaves department of the University of Idaho Library.

shortdesc: Historic Mining Films from Idaho's Silver Valley Mining District
description: A collection of historic mining films from Idaho's Silver Valley Mining District and elsewhere, originally filmed by Harry Webb Marsh.
imagetitle: Bunker Hill, Glory Hole, Kellogg, Idaho

shortdesc: Japanese ceramics from archaeological sites in the American West.
description: The Historical Japanese Ceramic Comparative Collection (HJCCC) provides researchers with comparative examples of Japanese ceramics that are found on North American archaeological sites. The HJCCC contains digital photographs and resources for identifying and describing Japanese ceramics manufactured during the Meiji, Taisho, and early Showa eras (roughly the mid-nineteenth and early twentieth centuries). It is intended to assist in identification of historical Japanese ceramics, to encourage the use of standardized terminology, and to promote further research.
imagetitle: Composite of various pieces from the collection

shortdesc: A Special Collections & Archives Historical Photograph Database
description: A Special Collections & Archives Historical Photograph Database

shortdesc: From Aberdeen to Yellow Dog - Historical Photos of 134 Cities and Towns, 1862 - 1998
description: The 1083 historical photographs in the Idaho Cities & Towns collection document Idaho cities and towns from the mid 1800s to the end of the twentieth century.
imagetitle: Sunday School group standing in front of church building in Avon, Idaho.

shortdesc: A collection of maps, images, and documents pertinent to the history of the Civilian Conservation Corps in Idaho
description: A collection of maps, images, and documents pertinent to the history of the CCC in Idaho representing the research discoveries of Patricia Hart and Ivar Nelson, who spent over two years traveling across the state to find and scan materials related to the CCC.

shortdesc: 50+ Years worth of Vandal Football Gameday Program Covers, 1908 - 1967
description: The Idaho Vandals Football Historical Game day Program Covers Collection consists of over 50 years worth of game day program covers (1908-1967) produced for football contests that took place all over the country.
location: University of Idaho (MacLean Field, Neale Stadium); Moscow, ID; Arizona; California; Montana; West Point, NY; North Dakota; Oregon; Utah; Washington State University; University of Washington;

colltitle: Idaho Forest Wildlife and Range Experiment Station Collection
cdmtitle: Idaho Forest Wildlife and Range Experiment Station
categories: Forests; Idaho; Northwest; UI; Water; Rangeland; Wilderness; UIResearch
shortdesc: UI-led research on topics ranging from Idaho's forests and hydrology to rangeland, fisheries, and wildlife, published from 1954 to the present
description: Over 200 documents and reports created by faculty in the UI Foestry Department of the College of Natural Resources, 1954 to the present
imagetitle: Focus on Renewable Natural Resources Fiscal 1981 Annual Report

shortdesc: The University of Idaho Forestry Department's Annual, 1917 - 1997
description: The Idaho Forester was published annually from 1917 - 1997 by the University of Idaho's forestry program. The journal combines research articles, UI program activities information, and analysis of the forest products industry, formerly the dominant industry in Northern Idaho. The collection was developed with the support of a Project Ceres Grant from the Center for Research Libraries and the United States Agricultural Information Network.

shortdesc: Documents and images from miscellaneous collections pertaining to the history of forestry in Idaho
description: Documents and images from miscellaneous collections pertaining to the history of forestry in Idaho

shortdesc: Historic air photos of Idaho from 1927 to the 1980s
description: The Idaho Historical Aerial Photographs are a collection of both oblique and vertical historic air photos ranging from 1927 to the 1980s.

shortdesc: A small collection of large historic maps, 1887-1984
description: A small collection of large maps that depict the Coeur D'Alene mining region, covering areas of Montana and Idaho (Shoshone County). These maps come from the Bunker Hill Mining Company Records, 1887-1984, a manuscript collection held by the University of Idaho Library's Special Collections & Archives department.
location: Shoshone County, ID; Wallace, ID; Kellogg, ID; Burke, ID; Silver Valley, ID; Mullan, ID; Wardner, ID;

shortdesc: Proud Histories from the Gem State
description: Idaho Queered is a collection of LGBTQ+ Oral Histories that were recorded during 2017-2018. Featuring interviews with queer Idahoans that detail their experiences with coming out, fighting discrimination, and navigating the particular challenges of their lives, the project aims to help preserve LGBTQ history through audio and video storytelling.
imagetitle: State of Idaho with participant's images representing counties

shortdesc: An interactive snow load application based on geographic areas in Idaho.
description: This resources relates to the report 'Ground and Roof Snow Loads for Idaho,' which was released in 1986 by the Department of Civil Engineering at the University of Idaho. To read the report and it's appendices, click on the cover. To use the map, click on the map. This map has been made possible by several years of nonfunded work. We respectfully request that if you use this map or report for commercial purposes, you purchase a pdf/map (information at top right) or donate to the University of Idaho Library.

shortdesc: Scientific and technical reports, with an emphasis on Idaho Water Resources Research Institute reports and publications
description: The Idaho Waters Digital Library provides access to information resources relating to water issues in key Idaho river basins. The collection presently includes scientific and technical reports, with an emphasis on [Idaho Water Resources Research Institute](https://www.uidaho.edu/research/iwrri) reports and publications. Documents can be browsed by [Location](map.html 'Browse by Map'), [Date](timeline.html 'Browse by Time'), and [Subject Term](subjects.html 'Browse by Subject') by using the tabs above. The database can also be queried extensively using the [Table](table.html 'Browse/Search by Table') feature. This project would not have been possible without the grant support of the [United States Geological Survey](https://www.uidaho.edu/research/iwrri/aboutiwrri), the administrative support of the [Idaho Water Resources Research Institute](https://www.uidaho.edu/research/iwrri/aboutiwrri), the metadata & digitization work of Warren Bromley-Vogel, and the conceptual efforts of Jodi Haire.
location: Idaho; Coeur D'Alene, ID; Lewiston, ID; Boise, ID;
imagetitle: Research in water resources for Idaho

shortdesc: Interactive database that provides access to geospatial data and information by, for, and about Idaho.
description: INSIDE Idaho is the official geospatial data clearinghouse for the State of Idaho. INSIDE Idaho serves as a comprehensive geospatial data digital library, providing access to, and a context within which to use, geospatial data and information by, for, and about Idaho.

shortdesc: Documents and images from miscellaneous collections pertaining to the history of forestry in Idaho
description: Research articles and other documents produced by individuals and entities from the University of Idaho.

shortdesc: A collection of reports, studies, and documents published by the Intermountain Forestry Cooperative
description: A collection of reports, studies, and documents published by the Intermountain Forest Tree Nutrition Cooperative (IFTNC), a research cooperative composed of public and private forestry organizations that is located administratively in the College of Natural Resources at the University of Idaho.

shortdesc: A Collection of Jazz Collections
description: The International Jazz Collections (IJC) was formally established at the University of Idaho in 2000, featuring papers and photographs of the legendary Lionel Hampton. The IJC merged with the University of Idaho Library's Special Collections & Archives department in 2007. It is now the preeminent jazz archive in the Pacific Northwest.

shortdesc: Scores from the Joe Williams Collection.
description: Joe Williams was a vocalist who began singing professionally in the late 1930’s. He worked with the big bands of Coleman Hawkins, Lionel Hampton and Count Basie; it was with Basie that Williams had his first recording hits. Williams won many awards and professional recognition. In the 1980’s he had a recurring role (as “Grandpa Al�?) on TV’s The Cosby Show. He died in Las Vegas on March 29, 1999.
imagetitle: Score for They Can't Take That Away from Me

shortdesc: Documenting the daily life of Japanese Americans interned by the US Government near Kooskia, ID durning World War II
description: The Kooskia Internment Camp Scrapbook documents the sights, tasks, scenes, and events of Japanese men detained during the camp's two years or operation (May 1943 - May 1945). The camp was located in a remote area of north central Idaho, 30 miles from the town of Kooskia; it was administered by the U.S. Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS) for the U.S. Department of Justice.
imagetitle: Kooskia Internment Camp Scrapbook Entrance Sign

shortdesc: Historical Photographs of Idaho and the United States, 1931 - 1979
description: The images of the Kyle Laughlin Photograph Collection, taken from 1931 to 1979, depict Idaho's natural scenery and historic sites, as well as personal moments from Kyle Laughlin's life. Laughlin was a Moscow, Idaho resident and businessman for 56 years; he owned several businesses, including a photo shop, an appliance store, and a television/cable company.
location: Idaho; Washington; Montgomery, AL; Acoma Village, NM; Topeka, KS; St. Louis, MO; Denver, CO; Cheyenne, WY; Little Bighorn Battlefield, MT; Vaseux Lake, B.C.

categories: Idaho; Northwest; Forests; Wilderness; Fire; Latah; Moscow, ID; Potlatch, ID
shortdesc: Materials from the NEH Funded Common Heritage Community Digitization Project in Latah County
description: The Latah County Common Heritage Collection was driven by funding from a National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) Common Heritage Grant awarded to the University of Idaho Library in 2016. The materials in this collection were collected via community digitization days held in Moscow and Potlatch in 2016 and 2017.
imagetitle: Kelvin Daniels in front of fire

cdmtitle: Latah County Historical Society Photograph Collection
categories: Idaho; Northwest; Forests; Wilderness; Fire; Latah; Moscow, ID; Potlatch, ID; Oral History
shortdesc: Remembering Latah County and Idaho Life at the turn of the 20th century
description: In the mid 1970s, the Latah County Historical Society collected over 300 oral histories from local Northern Idaho residents who grew up in Idaho during the early part of the 20th century. The Latah County Oral History Project produced one of the largest collections of oral histories in the Pacific Northwest. A copy of the transcripts and cassette recordings was donated to the University of Idaho Library in 1987. Those items were digitized and uploaded into our database in 2013.

shortdesc: Images and recordings from the Lee Morse Collection.
description: Lee Morse was an American singer and songwriter. The collection includes mainly photographs and sound recordings.

shortdesc: Historic interviews with jazz musicians, recorded by jazz critic Leonard Feather
description: The Blindfold Tests are a series of interviews conducted by jazz critic Leonard Feather with prominent jazz musicians throughout the 20th century.

shortdesc: Papers, recordings, and photographs from the collection of Leonard Feather.
description: The Leonard Feather Collection includes a variety of materials that document and describe the Jazz scene during the middle of the twentieth century. Feather was born in London in 1914 and moved to New York City in 1939. He was a journalist, producer, composer and jazz critic. The collection contains- photos, notebooks, sketches, scores, correspondence, clippings, manuscripts, notes and financial papers.
mediatype: images; documents; audio; illustrations; scores; video
imagetitle: Leonard Feather and Maragaret Sands at the Savoy Ballroom

shortdesc: A newsletter documenting daily life in Lewiston Orchards, Idaho (1913-1914)
description: Lewiston Orchards Life was a newsletter published in Lewiston, Idaho during the early 1900s. The newsletter covers the residential and horticultural lives of those living in the Lewiston Orchards area, which is now a residential neighborhood.

shortdesc: Memorabilia related to the University of Idaho's Jazz Festival, 1969-2020
description: A digital collection comprised of 30 years' worth of posters, programs, photographs, and oral histories related to the Lionel Hampton Jazz Festival at the University of Idaho.

shortdesc: Scores, documents and images from the Lionel Hampton Collection
description: The materials in the Lionel Hampton collection span most of his musical career, 1926–2002, with the bulk of the collection dating 1940–1990. The digital collection includes photographs, arrangements, and images of awards and ephemera.

categories: Forests; Fire; Wilderness; Mining; UI; Idaho; Sports; Maps
shortdesc: An interactive Google map application that allows users to browse over 8000 images on a digital map
description: The Map Room is an interactive Google map application that allows users to browse over 8000 images on a digital map. Use the drop down menus and search box at the top of each map to further refine your browsing.

shortdesc: Materials from the life of Mark B. Calnon, World War II Pilot and Prisoner of War
description: The Mark Brooks Calnon Collection consists of estate materials from 2nd. Lt. Mark Brooks Calnon, including memorabilia relating to his experiences in World War II as a pilot and prisoner of war. The collection includes photographs, documents, an oral history (audio/video/transcript), and a copy of Calnon's book, Some Lived, Some Died It Was Understood. The collection was put together by Journalism and Mass Media Professor Denise Bennett as part of a Seed Grant funded project.

shortdesc: A collection of family history-related items form the McCall Public Library
description: A collection of family history-related items form the McCall Public Library

shortdesc: A collection of MosCon artifacts celebrating the Palouse Empire Science Fiction Association's decades of fandom on the Palouse
description: MosCon was a vibrant regional science fiction convention based in Moscow, Idaho, organized by the Palouse Empire Science Fiction Association (PESFA). This digital collection provides access to MosCon program booklets and related artifacts for the twenty-two annual conventions held from 1979 to 2001.

shortdesc: Japanese Americans, Japan, Idaho and the University
description: This exhibit explores the impact that World War II had not only on those of Japanese ancestry in the United States, but also those in Japan who survived and rebuilt after the use of the atomic bomb and the role Idaho played through it all. It looks at the atrocities of war and the resilience and hope of those who live through it.

shortdesc: 20th Century photographs of the Nez Perce/Niimíipuu Native Americans
description: The Nez Perce Historical Portrait Collection includes nearly 600 photographs of individuals and groups from the Nez Perce/Nimíipuu tribe. Most photographs were taken during the first half of the 20th century. Much of the collection is comprised of studio photographs that have been taken of both individuals and families.
location: Nez Perce National Historical Park; Lapwai, ID; Spalding, ID;

shortdesc: Digitized Historical Postcards from Idaho and the Greater Northwest
description: This digital collection of over 800 postcards comes from the historical photograph collections of the University of Idaho Library's Special Collections & Archives. The postcards range in date from the 1890s to the 1980s.
location: Washington; Oregon; Idaho; Montana; Wyoming; British Columbia; Alberta
imagetitle: Syinga Time, Lake Pend Oreille, North Idaho

shortdesc: Photographs from local Clifford M. Ott depicting northern Idaho as it was, 1890 - 1980
description: Clifford M. Ott donated this broad collection of historical photographs in 1992. Ott was an avid amateur photographer who amassed over 10,000 slides, prints, and negatives spanning the years from 1883 to 1990. The digital collection represents a selection from Ott's whole collection, which he compiled into eleven albums containing a total of over 1,800 images of Moscow and surrounding Latah County and used to educate local citizens.
location: Latah County, ID; Moscow, ID; Genesee, ID; Potlatch, ID; Princeton, ID; Harvard, ID; Lewiston, ID; Clarkston, WA; Troy, MT; Livingston, MT; Ralston, NE;

categories: Idaho; Northwest; Forests; Wilderness; Fire; Latah; Potlatch, ID
shortdesc: Potlatch Historical Society Collection Depicting life in and around Potlatch, Idaho from 1880 to 1998
description: Potlatch Historical Society Collection Depicting life in and around Potlatch, Idaho from 1880 to 1998

categories: Idaho; Northwest; Forests; Wilderness; Fire; Latah; Potlatch, ID
shortdesc: A collection of over 1500 photographs from the Potlatch Lumber Company
description: A collection of over 1500 photographs from the Potlatch Lumber Company

shortdesc: Historical Photographs of Priest lake, Idaho and the surrounding area, 1880 - 1950
description: A digital collection comprised of 380 historical photographs of Priest Lake, Idaho and the surrounding area. The images span the years 1880 to 1950, documenting the area's waters, boats, buildings, landscape and people.
location: Priest Lake, ID; Upper Priest Lake, ID; Priest River, ID; Coolin, ID; Idaho;

shortdesc: Materials from the Frank B. Robinson Papers documenting Psychiana, a religion popular in the 1930s and 40s
description: Materials from the Frank B. Robinson Papers documenting Psychiana, a religion popular in the 1930s and 40s
imagetitle: Photograph of Clerical and Bookkeeping Staff from the Branch Mailing Department.

shortdesc: A repository of information created by University of Idaho researchers related to topics in rangeland ecology and managemen
description: The Rangeland Center collection is a repository of information created by University of Idaho researchers related to topics in rangeland ecology and management. Subject areas include ecology of rangelands, grazing management, invasive plants, fire ecology, and more.

shortdesc: Images from the Ray Brown Collection.
description: A small collection of the photographs and awards of Ray Brown, a renowned jazz double bassist and cellist.

shortdesc: A collection of photographs by Robert E. Higgins, a professor of plant science at the University of Idaho from 1946 to 1999
description: A collection of photographs by Robert E. Higgins, a professor of plant science at the University of Idaho from 1946 to 1999. During his lifetime, Professor Higgins' photographs were accepted in over 70 juried international salons, and he had one-artist exhibitions in Idaho, Washington, and California.

categories: Idaho; Water; Forests; Wilderness; Oral History; Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness Region
shortdesc: Oral histories, photographs, and other documents from an NEH funded exploration into the human aspects of the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness
description: This collection represents the digital objects of the Selwaay-Bitterroot Wilderness History Project, which is an NEH funded exploration into the human aspects of the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness.
location: Lolo Pass, MT; Lolo Hot Springs, MT; Elk Summit, ID; Freeman Peak, ID; Moose Meadows, ID; Shissler Peak Lookout, ID; Shearer Guard Station, ID; Trapper Peak, ID; Paradise Campground, ID;

shortdesc: A collection of scrapbooks containing memorabilia regarding Senator William Edgar Borah. The scrapbooks consist of newspaper clippings, magazine articles, letters, photographs, and recordings Borah's speeches.
description: William Edgar Borah was a Republican Senator from Idaho. He first became a candidate for the U.S. Senate in 1903, but was defeated by Weldon Heyburn. He was elected in 1907 and served in that body until his death in 1940. In 1924 he became chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee. He also served on the Judiciary Committee. He was often mentioned as a presidential candidate, but not until 1936 did he actually enter any primaries; his defeat at the convention by Alf Landon was not unexpected. This collection consists of scrapbooks containing newspaper clippings, magazine articles, letters, photographs, and recordings of four of his speeches.

shortdesc: Writings and memorabilia of Stanton Gilbert Fisher, pioneer and Nez Perce War scout, 1840-1915
description: Writings and memorabilia of Stanton Gilbert Fisher, pioneer and Nez Perce War scout, 1840-1915. Most of the documents are Nez Perce War collectibles, such as maps, photographs and accounts of the war and its participants. The rest of the papers are personal materials related to Fisher, including autobiographical materials as well as the correspondence and census records of several of his family members.
location: Central Idaho; Beaverhead National Forest, MT; White Bird Battlefield, ID;

shortdesc: Ranching, Hunting, and Pack Train Operations in North Central Idaho, 1900-1931
description: A digital collection comprised of 540 historical photographs taken by William Allen Stonebraker at the turn of the century and into the 1920s and 1930s documenting the Salmon River, the Frank Church-River of No Return, the Chamberlain Basin, and the Thunder Mountain Gold Rush.
location: Salmon River; Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness (Idaho); Chamberlain Basin, ID;

shortdesc: Log books detailing daily events at the Taylor Wilderness Research Station, 1997-2010
description: The nine log books in this collection detail daily events from 1997 to 2010 recounted by those living and working at the Taylor Wilderness Research Station. In addition to describing the routine research and maintenance task, the logs also provide wildlife sightings and firsthand accounts of harrowing events, such as the dramatic forest fire and evacuation of the year 2000.
location: Taylor Ranch, ID; Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness (Idaho)

shortdesc: Photos from President's Roosevelt's historic visit to the University of Idaho campus in 1911
description: A collection of photographs from the University of Idaho Historical Photographs Collection commemorating the 100th anniversary of President's Roosevelt's historic visit to the University of Idaho campus in 1911.
location: University of Idaho (Admin Lawn); Moscow, ID;
imagetitle: Roosevelt on platform in front of University of Idaho Administration Building leaning toward Idaho Governor James Hawley

shortdesc: Open Access Repository of University of Idaho Graduate ETD
description: An open access repository of theses and dissertations from University of Idaho graduate students. The collection includes complete electronic theses and dissertations submitted since approximately 2014, as well as digitized copies of earlier documents going back to 1910.
imagetitle: Distribution of Salt and Moisture in Butter as affected by storage, a 1917 Thesis written by Ricahrd D. Canan

shortdesc: Curated articles on environmental, conservation, and ecological issues in the Inland and Pacific Northwest Region, 1988 - 2000
description: The Transitions Journal Digital Collection is a digital repository for Transitions, a conservation-focused publication edited and published by John Osborn from 1988 to 2000.

colltitle: The Trees Grew Tall Photograph Collection
shortdesc: Photographs used in the making of the book The Trees Grew Tall, 1898 - 1943
description: A digital collection comprised of 242 photographs of life in Bovill, Idaho and surrounding areas from 1898 - 1943. These photographs were taken or collected by Bovill native and author John B. Miller.

cdmtitle: University of Idaho Historical Photograph Collection
shortdesc: Photographs documenting campus life at the Univesity of Idaho from 1890 to 1980
description: A variety of photographs from several photographic collections held by Special Collections & Archives that depict scenes from the University of Idaho's past. Includes portraits of past professors and alumni, as well as photos of buildings and events.

colltitle: University of Idaho Student Organizations Collection (PG2)
cdmtitle: University of Idaho Student Organizations Collection (PG2)
shortdesc: Historic images documenting activities of University of Idaho Student Organizations, 1898-1992
description: The University of Idaho Student Organizations Collection is a collection of digitized historical images focused on student organizations and events at the University of Idaho’s main campus in Moscow, ID. This digital collection is mostly taken from the library’s Special Collections & Archive’s UI Student Organizations Collection, which is referred to as Photograph Group 2 (PG2). The collection comprises thousands of images spanning from 1893 to the early 1990s.

shortdesc: A public poetry project that brings relevant contemporary poetry to the University of Idaho and the broader Idaho community.
Historic videos of University of Idaho Basketball and Football Games, 1925 - 1997
description: The Vandal Video Collection is a collection of 160+ digitized 16mm Film reels that were scouting videos for both football and basketball games..
location: University of Idaho (Maclean Field, Neale Stadium, Kibbie Dome); Moscow, ID;

shortdesc: A research-focused discovery tool that enables collaboration
description: VIVO is a research-focused discovery tool that enables collaboration among scholars across all disciplines. The system allows users to browse or search information on University people, departments, courses, grants, and publications.

shortdesc: Oral Histories from the International Gay Rodeo Association
description: Partnering with the International Gay Rodeo Association to collect and preserve people’s experiences as LGBTQ+ westerners, this project seeks to protect endangered histories and relocate LGBTQ+ people back into the American West as people continue to build resilient communities.
